title: BBC Local Live: Shropshire - BBC News
summary: investigation blames security glitch for porn on street sign .
arrest in connection with rape of man .
three route options for m54 link road on display .
shropshire towns among heart of england in bloom winners .

documents.title: leitch-smith joins dundee on loan
text: leitch-smith joins dundee on loan

documents.title: oldham athletic 1-2 shrewsbury town
text: oldham athletic 1-2 shrewsbury town

documents.title: pet shop chain to go into administration
text: pet shop chain to go into administration

documents.title: our coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on monday .

documents.title: police treating dawley car fire as arson
text: a car fire in dawley on monday night appears to have been started deliberately , the police have said .
a volvo was badly damaged in hinkshay road and while no-one was hurt , the owners are said to be extremely distressed .

there have been a number of car fires in the telford area over the summer , including one caught on cctv last month and the police are hoping this attack might also have been caught on someone 's camera .
at this stage they ca n't say if this was a targeted attack .

documents.title: football : haughmond look to spring another fa cup shock
text: the amateurs of haughmond fc are looking to pull off a real fa cup shock when they travel to lincolnshire to take on boston tomorrow
the shropshire side have already made it through three of the early stages , beating matlock in the previous round .
club captain tom hewitt , a carpenter , admits it 's a tough draw , but believes they can progress .

documents.title: legionella bacteria found at hospital
text: legionella bacteria found at hospital

documents.title: weather : some showers tomorrow , but sunday looking dry
text: we 're going to have a few more showers tomorrow afternoon , but it 's looking a lot drier on sunday .
author: Rebecca Wood
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: council 'glitch ' led to porn on sign
text: council 'glitch ' led to porn on sign

documents.title: anger at year-long whitchurch road closure
text: a potential year-long closure of a whitchurch road to repair damage caused by badgers is `` unacceptable '' , say residents .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: painted rocks to raise awareness of child sex exploitation
text: painted purple rocks have been appearing all over shropshire today , to raise awareness of child sex exploitation .
people finding the stones are being asked to photograph them and post them on social media , to spread the message around .

documents.title: ex-teacher jailed for abusing pupils
text: ex-teacher jailed for abusing pupils

documents.title: 'glitch in security ' allowed porn to appear on council signs
text: a council investigation into how pornographic images came to be on one of their digital street signs in telford has concluded the sign was n't hacked .
instead telford and wrekin council believes there was a glitch in the signs ' security settings which allowed a passer-by to simply search for the content and put it on display .
the council added that a `` thorough review of security settings '' was now being carried out and the signs would remain switched off for the time being .

documents.title: your photos : a fine afternoon in horsehay and ironbridge
text: the rain seems to have stayed away today and the bbc weather watchers have been out and about , snapping photos of the county .
these ones were taken in horsehay ( top ) and ironbridge ( below ) .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: football : the new saints look to continue winning run
text: the new saints are looking to make it four welsh premier wins on the bounce tonight , but face a tough challenge , away to cardiff met .
both sides have lost just once in the welsh premier league this season .

documents.title: breakinglegionella bacteria found at ludlow hospital 'not a risk '
text: legionella bacteria has been found at ludlow hospital .
the shropshire community health trust says it was discovered in routine water samples and it is not the type which causes legionnaires ' disease .
the health trust also said patients , staff and visitors were not at risk and it was not connected with the outbreak at the feathers hotel , in ludlow .

documents.title: fire at house in woodside
text: firefighters were called to a house in the woodside area of telford last night , to deal with a fire in a ground floor bedroom .
they were called out at 23:40 and had it out in half an hour .
nobody was reported hurt .

documents.title: hurst excited by shrewsbury 's good start
text: hurst excited by shrewsbury 's good start

documents.title: m54 link plans welcomed by council leader
text: plans for a link road connecting the m54 with the m6 and m6 toll have been described as `` one big step forward '' by the leader of telford and wrekin council .

councillor shaun davies said shropshire 's links to the motorway network were `` woeful '' at the moment and that transport links came up `` time and time again '' when he talked to business leaders .
three options for the link road are being put forward by highways england , which says it could take 22,000 vehicles a day off small a roads .
one of the big , big issues , time and time again is our transport links and our transport links in shropshire are woeful , on to the motorway network

documents.title: arrest over reported rape of man in shrewsbury
text: a man 's been arrested today in connection with a reported rape of a man in shrewsbury earlier this month .
west mercia police says it was told the incident happened in the new street area on 9 september .
the force says it 's arrested a 35-year-old man from shrewsbury on sus of rape and he 's being questioned by detectives .
author: BBC Shropshire

documents.title: football : mixed injury news for telford squad
text: midfielder jordan lussey is a doubt for afc telford 's fa cup tie with barwell this weekend after he up a groin strain in the midweek win over stockport .
but curtis strong and matty barnes-holmer could both be fit .
barwell could include former telford striker kyle perry in their team after a recent move .
he 's playing for his 17th club .
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: m54 link road plans : ancient woodland impact from one option
text: ancient staffordshire woodland could be in the path of a new link road under one option to connect the m54 with the m6 and m6 toll .
highways england has produced three options for the route , which is aimed at stopping drivers having to leave the m54 and use local a-roads in order to get to the other motorways .
a consultation 's started today on the three routes and one of them , option c east , would see the existing m54 widened from junction one towards the m6 .
but highways england says that choice would then see it `` affecting '' areas of ancient woodland at burn 's wood , spring cop and keeper 's wood .
author: Allen Cook
BBC Local Live

documents.title: heart of england in bloom awards for shropshire towns
text: oswestry , shrewsbury , ludlow and bridgnorth have all won gold awards in the heart of britain in bloom competition .
oswestry was also named the best in the large town category .
the park at brignorth castle , oswestry 's cae glas park and a ludlow couple who 've transformed a railway embankment were given discretionary awards .

documents.title: football : shrewsbury manager appreciates support from fans
text: shrewsbury town manager paul hurst says his players appreciate the support from people living in the town .
the team goes into this weekend three points clear at the top of league one .
they are yet to be beaten in the league and hurst thinks fans ' expectations are being raised as a result .
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: council leader wants answers over hospital funding
text: concerns about the costs of hospital reorganisation have been raised again by the leader of telford and wrekin council .

the nhs is proposing a shake-up of hospital services , which would involve making shrewsbury the main base for emergency medicine in the county and moving specialist women and children 's services there too .
the plans also involve moving the bulk of planned operations to telford .

an independent scrutiny report earlier this year said that for the proposals to move forward , they would need to provide a clearer vision of how community care would be managed and how the changes would be financed .
councillor shaun davies said it was still unclear how the work would be financed and it was too soon to start consulting on the proposals .
there is no guarantee of money for this project , so the consultation that is taking place is on a solution , and some people will think it is a solution , without any cash in place

documents.title: comments wanted on shrewsbury vision of the future
text: people living and working in shrewsbury are being invited to have their say on the way the town is developed .

the group set up to represent local business , shrewsbury bid , is consulting on its big town plan with the town council and has set up shop in an empty unit on wyle cop - inviting passers-by to drop in to take a look .
one of its aims is to create a `` new central business district , with an employment cluster '' near the rail station .

shrewsbury bid says the plan has been developed because the town faces a number of challenges , including an ageing population , poor public transport , a relatively low wage economy and over-reliance on the car .
the proposals will be on display until 29 september and after that a more detailed plan will be drawn up .

documents.title: ice hockey : tigers travel to basingstoke for bison rematch
text: telford tigers travel to basingstoke tomorrow for a re-match against the bison in the autumn cup .
the two sides met at the telford ice rink last weekend , with the tigers winning the game 2-1 .
the tigers are still looking to add another player to their roster , after the departure of macauley halford yesterday .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: football : brown thinks he can learn from shrewsbury manager
text: shrewsbury town left back junior brown feels he 's getting special attention from his manager paul hurst , because he was a left back in his playing career .
he said he thought it was probably an unconscious thing and that he could learn a thing or two from hurst , who played nearly 500 games in the position .
i do n't think it 's intentional , but you know when you 're a player and you play in that sort of position it 's something that you focus on , you see things .
but at the same time it 's good .
he can impart his knowledge on me .
so it 's good for me , learning my trade as a left back and it 's certainly helping improve my performances

documents.title: telford councillors told 'stay off internet if angry '
text: councillors have been given social media training in a bid to avoid potentially embarrassing or costly online gaffes .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: coracle championship record bid
text: a record number of teams have entered this year 's coracle world championship , which takes place in shrewsbury today .
competitors from 48 teams will hope to set a new world record for crossing the width of the river severn in a coracle eight times - they are raising money for macmillan cancer support .
the current record time is five minutes and 20 seconds .

documents.title: girl seriously injured in hit-and-run
text: an 11-year-old girl has been seriously injured by a hit-and-run driver in knighton , near the shropshire/powys border , police say .
she was airlifted to hospital after being hit by a dark coloured toyota rav 4 near the town 's hospital , at about 16:00 yesterday .
dyfed-powys police say the car had the registration number du12 llj .

documents.title: route options for m54 link road on display
text: three options for a link road connecting the m54 with the m6 and m6 toll are going on show to the public today .
traffic currently travels up a roads and highways england says a link road would take about 22,000 vehicles a day off the a460 and relieve congestion through places such as featherstone .
it also says the link road would support economic growth in the area by making it more accessible .
consultation on the three route options will continue until 13 october .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Local Live

documents.title: video : your 50-second weather forecast
text: after a chilly start it will be a bright day with sunny spells with the chance of a few showers this afternoon .
feeling cool for september with top temperatures of 16c ( 61f ) .
author: Sara Blizzard
BBC Weather

documents.title: welcome to our live updates for the day
text: welcome to live updates from bbc shropshire on friday morning .
we 'll be bringing you all the news , sport , travel and weather as it happens .
if you 'd like to get in touch you can email , tweet us on @ twitterid or message via facebook .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: tns chairman up for second award
text: the new saints chairman mike harris is nominated not just once , but twice for the natwest great british entrepreneur awards .

as well as being shortlisted in the entrepreneur for good award category for his work with the football club , he is included in the voting for the innovation entrepreneur of the year , for his work with sifi networks , a growing international fibre optic network developer .

documents.title: shropshire fundraiser named nation 's quirkiest
text: a whitchurch woman has been named as the british heart foundation 's quirkiest fundraiser of the year after climbing snowdon in a wedding dress .
the charity has released its top 10 from the past 12 months , revealing the unusual things people have done to raise funds for life saving research .
shropshire 's maxine beech has come out on top for her `` bridal walk '' - it followed the loss of her father george to a heart attack in 2009 .

documents.title: weather : more rain tonight and tomorrow
text: we are forecast more showers overnight and that weather is set to continue tomorrow , with the odd bright spell at times .
author: Shefali Oza
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: shrewsbury scheme to support young workers
text: an 18-year-old woman from shrewsbury has launched a scheme to improve working conditions for young staff at shops , bars , cafes and restaurants .
ella holmes wants employers to commit to giving them proper breaks , notice of shifts and fair tips policy .
in return , they will get a sticker to display and a mention on social media , so that customers can see their commitment to their staff .

the former shrewsbury sixth form student said the idea was already being supported by a number of cafes and bars in the town and she is getting the support of porthill councillor julian dean in getting it off the ground .

documents.title: rape investigators issue cctv image
text: this cctv image has been released by the police , showing a man they want to talk to in connection a rape in shrewsbury in the early hours of saturday .
the victim , a man in his 20s , was attacked in the new street area at around 03:10 .
police are asking if people saw anything sus around that time in the welsh bridge and frankwell areas and on the towpath between the boathouse pub and pengwern boat club .

documents.title: your photos : a fine afternoon in trench and badger
text: now that the rain has disappeared , we 're having a nice september afternoon and the bbc weather watchers have been sharing their photos from around the county .
these ones were taken near trench ( top ) and badger ( below ) .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: primark opening boosts shrewsbury shopper numbers
text: the owner of shrewsbury 's shopping centres says it has seen visitor numbers spike in the wake of the opening of the town 's new primark store .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: football : payne injury not as bad as feared
text: the foot injury suffered by shrewsbury striker stefan payne on tuesday night is n't as bad as first thought and he should be fit to travel to oldham on saturday , manager paul hurst says .
meanwhile , bryn morris is continuing his come back from injury and has been running today with physio chris skitt .
he should be back in training in a week or so .

documents.title: former priest charged with sex offences
text: former priest charged with sex offences

documents.title: brain injured telford couple to climb snowdon
text: a telford couple who both suffered serious brain injuries while changing a tyre on their daughter 's car on the motorway , are going to climb mount snowdon for charity this weekend .
kevin and louise french were injured in 2012 when a car crashed into them at 70mph and it was initially thought kevin would never walk or talk again .
louise suffered a broken neck and several other broken bones and both have been getting around with walking frames .
the couple have been practising by climbing lilleshall hill and the wrekin , and say they wanted to support the brain injury charity headway , because it supported them .
they are hoping to raise £ 1,000 , which will be spent on building headway 's new rehabilitation centre in shropshire .
while i was lying in my hospital bed i commented to the nurse that i would never run a marathon now .
but he just shrugged his shoulders and said 'so climb a mountain instead ' . ''
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: heavy rain could help salmon migration
text: recent heavy downpours could provide a timely boost for salmon beginning their migration up the river severn , the environment agency 's chris bainger says .
bit of extra water today in the # severn # shrewsburyweir should help the # salmon start their autumn run & get them over # barrierstomigration

documents.title: vineyard wants volunteers to help bring in harvest
text: a shropshire 's kerry vale vineyard is looking for volunteers to help bring in this year 's harvest .
the company , which is based near the welsh border , not far from churchstoke estimates it has around 10 tonnes of grapes and 6,000 vines and wants to get started on monday .
and because different varieties ripen at different rates , the vineyard will have another harvest at the end of the month .

documents.title: ice hockey : macauley halford leaves tigers
text: macauley halford has left telford tigers , with the club saying he had been unhappy with his contract .

the forward , who has been playing ice hockey in telford since 2010 , signed in the summer , but the tigers said `` it became apparent macauley was unhappy with those terms to which he had originally agreed and was seeking an improvement '' .
the tigers , who have a number of spare places on their roster , said they plan to announce a replacement .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: camra accolade for reopened pub
text: a shropshire couple are celebrating after making the new camra real ale guide for the first time , just 18 months after taking over a failing pub .
duncan borrowman and his wife grace bought the castle tavern in oswestry , renamed it the bailey head , cleaned it up , and introduced a new range of beers and spirits .
mr borrowman said when they first saw the pub they thought `` the building 's a great building '' and that it could be turned around if they could `` start with it afresh '' .
we were pretty amazed , it 's obviously good for businesses as well and will bring in people to oswestry from outside because it 's a new pub in the guide . ''

documents.title: breakingbody found in telford
text: a man in his 50s has been found dead outside a property in telford .
police say they were called to withywood drive in malinslee at about 07:40 and they are treating his death as unexplained at this time .
a post-mortem examination has yet to be carried out and officers say they are waiting for formal identification of the body , but say they have been in touch with the next of kin .

documents.title: pressure on ludlow services to be discussed
text: shropshire council leader peter nutting is holding a public meeting in ludlow today .
councillor nutting is keen to hear about how local services have been affected by financial pressures on the authority .
the meeting will be hosted by the ludlow and clee local joint committee at elim church , lower galdeford at 19:00 .

documents.title: weather watchers : your rainbow after downpour
text: a very wet start to the day , but it 's clearing in some parts of the county .
just clear enough for these rainbow shots from our weather watchers in whitchurch ( top ) and chirk ( bottom ) .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: hotel offers condolences to family of legionnaires ' victim
text: the feathers hotel in ludlow has expressed its condolences to the family of a guest who died after up legionnaires ' disease while staying there in july .
and it said that as soon as it learnt about the outbreak it started an investigation , with the support of environmental health authorities .

the hotel also explained it had taken the decision to close to allow it to fit a new plumbing system `` as quickly and safely '' as possible and that it would reopen as soon as it could be fitted , tested and approved .

we take the health and safety of our guests extremely seriously at the feathers and as soon as we learnt from the environmental health office of the issue related to our water system we have worked closely with them to investigate and carry out remedial action where necessary . ''

documents.title: sports injury conference in oswestry
text: some of the region 's best physios and doctors are taking part in a sports injury conference at the robert jones and agnes hunt orthopaedic hospital today .
the conference is a chance to discuss the latest issues regarding the treatment and prevention of sports injuries .

the hospital has some of the country 's leading sports injury consultants and they 've treated sports people like olympic equestrian star tim stockdale , who made a full recovery after fracturing his neck six years ago .
author: Ian Perry
BBC Radio Shropshire

documents.title: tns owner up for business award
text: mike harris , owner of oswestry side the new saints , has been nominated for a national business award .
his inclusion in the natwest great british entrepreneur awards shortlist is in recognition of his work in helping to develop and enhance the welsh premier league .
former dragons den star james caan is among the judges .

documents.title: hotel tested free of legionnaires ' after april outbreak
text: public health england said that the feathers hotel had tested free of legionnaires ' after a previous outbreak in april .
a woman in her early 70s came down with the disease after a stay there , but has since made a recovery .
the health body said it carried out tests and found the legionella bacteria was present , but after the hotel carried out remedial work , the tests came back negative .
public health england said `` this suggests the problem was intermittent '' .

documents.title: vandals target oswestry castle excavation site
text: vandals have spray-painted oswestry castle , which is currently being excavated by a team of archaeologists .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: councillor calls for full investigation into legionnaires ' outbreak
text: a ludlow councillor has called for a full council investigation into the legionnaires ' outbreak at the feathers hotel in ludlow , following the death of a guest who contracted the disease there .

councillor andy boddington described the hotel as one of three iconic buildings in the town and said it should remain closed for as long as it takes to fix the plumbing , even if this takes several months .
public health england said `` extensive work is now needed to overhaul and treat the plumbing '' , because that 's where the legionella bacteria is thought to have originated .
that work is expected to take about three weeks .

documents.title: health bosses want to hear from midwives
text: the first in a number of workshops into the future of shropshire 's midwife-led units begins today in oswestry .
health commissioners are looking at ways to improve the service .
no decision has been made , but a report shows they 're not delivering value for money and more midwives are needed on the busier wards in shrewsbury and telford .
maternity services across shropshire are under the spotlight after a number of avoidable deaths over recent years .
a care quality commission ( cqc ) report published last month said overall care had got better but safety in maternity services `` needed further improvement '' .

documents.title: hurricane irma : 'we were fortunate ' , say shropshire couple
text: ex-salopians now living in florida have been describing their experiences of hurricane irma .
john tongue and janie tongue , who moved from telford to central florida in 2004 , say they were among the fortunate ones .
the eye of the hurricane passed just 15 miles west of where they live .
john says wind speeds reached up to 110mph ( 177km/h ) but they survived without any structural damage .

documents.title: football : nolan wants more after debut goal
text: jon nolan is targeting 10 goals for shrewsbury town this season - after his first proved to be the match-winner against southend on tuesday .
that debut-goal kept shrewsbury top of league one and nolan 's keen for more .
the town midfielder says he 's being pushed by manager paul hurst to `` have a go '' more often .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: indecent images of children 'did n't involve shropshire pupils '
text: a shropshire head teacher says none of the offences which led to a teacher being banned for life for receiving indecent images of children , took place while he was teaching at the marches school in oswestry .
david gideon taught law there in 2014 .
alison pearson said as soon as the school was alerted that mr gideon was part of a social services investigation , he was suspended and did n't return .
it emerged yesterday that mr gideon has n't faced prosecution .

documents.title: look out for heavy rain and thunder
text: some heavy bursts of rain across shropshire this morning .
take a look at this shot from the met office at raf shawbury .
heavy # showers early this morning , with the odd rumble of thunder , become more isolated and intensify again late afternoon .
take a coat !
^hs

documents.title: fatal legionnaires ' outbreak at hotel
text: the ludlow hotel at the centre of a fatal outbreak of legionnaire 's disease , is expected to remain closed for at least three weeks .
public health england is writing to guests who 've stayed at the feathers in the last two weeks to establish if anyone has been suffering flu-like symptoms .
author: Sarah Bishop
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: video : your 50-second weather forecast
text: after a showery start for some there should be some brighter spells before the rain returns this afternoon .
we can expect top temperatures of about 17c ( 63f ) .
author: Alex Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: bridge reopens after incident
text: the english bridge over the river severn in shrewsbury has now reopened following a police incident involving a vulnerable person .
the road was closed for a couple of hours between the bottom of wyle cop and abbey foregate .

documents.title: welcome to our live updates for the day
text: welcome to live updates from bbc shropshire on thursday morning .
we 'll be bringing you all the news , sport , travel and weather as it happens .
if you 'd like to get in touch you can email , tweet us on @ twitterid or message via facebook .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: dairy farmers recovering after low prices
text: after a hard 18 months , some of the farmers in telford say they are getting back on an even keel after some very low milk prices .
increased prices are driven by a shortage of milk in this country and a high butter price globally , but experts say farmers should be careful and think long term .
there are warnings that it 's a volatile market but farmers are enjoying the good times while they are here and it 's all about managing the good with the bad .
author: David Gregory-Kumar
Science correspondent, BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: midlands today
text: on today 's programme :
a hotel guest has died after contracting legionnaires ' disease and another fell ill following a stay at the same place , it has been revealed .
the feathers hotel in ludlow has voluntarily closed to the public on advice of health bosses .
tests showed links between legionella bacteria found in water samples from the hotel and the two guests , public health england said .
join me for bbc midlands today at 18:30 on bbc one .
author: Mary Rhodes
Presenter, BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: consultation on library services
text: book worms in ludlow and south shropshire are being reminded not to forget to have a say in the future of library services .
author: Ludlow & Tenbury Wells Advertiser

documents.title: watch : latest weather forecast
text: there will be further showers this evening , though the winds will be lighter than last night .
lows of 8c ( 46f ) .
thursday will be breezy and cool again .
there will be a few heavy showers around but these will be less frequent than they have been in recent days .
highs of 16c ( 61f ) .
author: Shefali Oza
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: mood buoyant at uk dairy event
text: in telford today you can see plenty of happy cows and even happy dairy farmers - so what 's going on ?
some farmers tell me that they 've seen a difference of 6p a litre in their milk cheques in the past couple of months , and are starting to break even .
today at the dairy show there 's an upbeat mood with good times around the corner and for some they 're here already .
author: David Gregory-Kumar
Science correspondent, BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: hotel guest dies of legionnaires ' disease but what is it ?
text: a hotel guest in ludlow has died after contracting legionnaires ' disease and another fell ill following a stay at the same place .
but what is legionnaires ' disease ?

documents.title: black park road closure likely to be long-term because of badgers
text: shroshire council has declined to put a time limit on how long whitchurch 's black park road will be closed after it suffered extensive damage because of badgers .
author: Whitchurch Herald

documents.title: unemployment falls
text: latest unemployment figures show the number of people out of work across the west midlands fell by 2,000 in the three months to july .
a total of 164,000 were out of work .
nationally the number of jobless now stands at 1.46 million - its lowest level since 1975 .
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: fatal legionnaires ' outbreak at hotel
text: fatal legionnaires ' outbreak at hotel

documents.title: search for soldiers who created ww1 quilt
text: a family from north shropshire and staff at the orthapaedic hospital in gobowen want to know more about the soldiers who stayed there during world war one .
injured soldiers were treated at the hospital during ww1 .
some of them made a patchwork quilt and presented it to staff , to thank them for their kindness .
the current owners have now leant the quilt back to the hospital , so it can go on display and they want to find out more about its origins .

documents.title: millions of pounds of business expected at dairy event
text: tens of millions of pounds of business is expected to be carried out at an agricultural event in telford today .
hundreds of farmers are gathered at the uk dairy day show at the telford international centre .
organiser richard jones , from holstein uk , said they would do deals for animal feed , milking machines , and medicines among other things .
farmers come here armed to sign contracts for the rest of the year and into next year . ''

documents.title: shropshire house price growth falls behind national average
text: shropshire 's house prices have grown again , new figures reveal - but the county continues to lag behind both the west midlands and the uk .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: attingham park looking for new head gardener
text: attingham park is looking to recruit a new head gardener to lead its team of gardeners , rangers and nearly 120 volunteers .
the estate includes 640 acres ( 260 hectares ) of parkland and gardens , and the job advert says it wants someone with `` extensive experience '' and leadership skills .
more than 465,000 people visit the property every year and the national trust says a big part of the job will be to make the estate interesting for them .

documents.title: last coach load of guests leaves legionnaires ' hotel
text: the last coach load of guests has left the feathers hotel , in ludlow , to allow a thorough overhaul of its plumbing system .
this is after a woman in her 60s died following a legionnaires ' outbreak .
public health england said the hotel had decided that with such a complex building , it was easier to carry out the work while it was empty .

documents.title: legionnaires ' victim was woman in her 60s
text: public health england says a person who died after contracting legionnaires ' disease at ludlow 's feathers hotel was a woman in her late 60s .
an inquest has yet to confirm the cause of her death , but the agency said it had carried out tests which confirmed she had contracted the disease .

documents.title: beauty products for cows among items on sale at dairy event
text: i bet you did n't know they sell beauty products for cows , but there 's a whole range on sale at the uk dairy day event in telford today .
these products are to get the cows looking clean and shiny for show judges .
earlier , the bovine equivalents of kate moss and heidi klum were getting a shave just before they entered the show ring to make sure they were looking their very best .
as i 've been watching the main show ring , i 've seen farmers apply a bit of spray to their cows .
author: Ian Perry
BBC Radio Shropshire

documents.title: shropshire mp questions police pay rise
text: north shropshire 's conservative mp owen paterson says he 's concerned about the extra money the government has promised police officers .
about 2,000 staff working for the west mercia force can expect a 1 % pay rise following yesterday 's announcement , but mr paterson warned that `` either comes from taxation or from borrowing '' .
the mp also said it was essentially the private sector paying for a wage increase in the public sector .
the money either comes from taxation or it comes from borrowing .
we still have to keep tight control of public expenditure because every one of these pounds has to be borrowed or taxed and that has to be paid for by people in the private sector . ''

documents.title: legionnaires ' symptoms 'similar to flu '
text: the early symptoms of legionnaires ' disease are similar to flu , public health england has said , with muscle aches , tiredness , headaches , dry cough and fever .
it is advising guests who have stayed at the feathers hotel in ludlow recently to get in touch , if they have experienced any of them .

the health agency said people become infected when contaminated water is released into the air and once in the lungs the bacteria can cause pneumonia or a less serious flu-like illness known as pontiac fever .

documents.title: local authority monitoring work at hotel after legionnaires ' outbreak
text: shropshire council is promising to closely monitor the work at the feathers hotel in ludlow , following the outbreak of legionnaires ' disease there .

public health england said that before it decided to close , the hotel had already shut affected rooms , disinfected the water system and employed heating contractors to investigate the boilers and pipework , but that a complete overhaul of the plumbing was needed .
teams from the council and public health england are at the hotel today and say they have been working closely with the owners .

documents.title: whitchurch herald front page : concern after hurricane devastation
text: a whitchurch childminder believes donations made by families in the town to cuban children will help take their minds off the devastation caused by hurricane irma .

documents.title: breakinghotel closes following fatal legionnaires ' disease outbreak
text: the feathers hotel in ludlow has closed after a guest from merseyside died after contracting legionnaires ' disease .
another guest who contracted the disease in april has since recovered .
public health england said the hotel made the decision voluntarily after the legionella bacterium was found in water samples from its plumbing system .
and it said the closure would allow `` extensive work '' to be carried out .
the hotel is also writing to guests who stayed at the hotel in the last two weeks , advising them to get in touch if they have experienced any symptoms of the disease .
extensive work is now needed to overhaul and treat the plumbing in such an old building , so that guests can fully enjoy the facilities .
the hotel has decided that with such a complex building it is easier and minimises risks to the public to close the hotel temporarily to conduct remedial works . ''

documents.title: football : southend 'pay shrewsbury a compliment '
text: shrewsbury town manager paul hurst believes southend paid them a compliment last night by adjusting the way they played to nullify his team .
they remain top of the league after a 1-0 win and hurst praised his players for digging in , saying there was `` one fantastic save '' from his goalkeeper dean henderson .
shrewsbury are still unbeaten in the league this season , with six wins and a draw and are three points clear at the top of the league one table .
we 've had a team come to us and match us up , so maybe that 's a little pat on the back for how the players have started the season . ''
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: police federation wants more pay for west mercia officers
text: west mercia police officers deserve more than the 1 % pay rise being offered by the government , the chair of the west mercia police federation has said .

russell yeomans called it a `` sad reflection of how politicians view the police service '' and said the government had failed to listen to the recommendations of a pay review body , which suggested a bigger pay rise .
mr yeomans also said the government 's payment to the dup , to win their support for a conservative administration , had proved `` they can find money when they need to '' .
it 's quite clear that for some time policing and police officers have not been a priority for the government . ''

documents.title: telford council leader 'will not apologise ' over a & e fight
text: telford and wrekin council 's leader has said he will not apologise for fighting to keep services at its local hospital .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: judging starts at dairy show
text: judging has started at the uk dairy day event at telford international centre .
a parade ring has been set up inside the building , for farmers to display their animals .
interesting to see them shave the cows just before they enter the ring , to make sure they were looking their very best .
author: Ian Perry
BBC Radio Shropshire

documents.title: storm aileen : more fallen trees reported
text: storm aileen does n't appear to have had a huge impact in the county , but shropshire council says a fallen tree is blocking the main road junction in pant glas .
telford and wrekin council says it has only had one report of a tree blowing down - on st leonards place in malinslee .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: lorry driver escapes with minor injuries after crash
text: a lorry driver who was trapped in his cab for 45 minutes after it overturned near preston gubbals yesterday was `` extremely fortunate '' not to suffer more severe injuries , west midlands ambulance service said .
the man in his 40s had to be cut free after a collision with a car .
he was treated for cuts to his hand , along with shoulder pain and a head injury , and taken to the royal shrewsbury hospital .
the man driving the car was out of his vehicle when ambulance staff arrived and was unhurt .

documents.title: police commissioner wants more money following pay rise announcement
text: the police commissioner for west mercia says he will continue to make the case for more funding , after the government announced many officers should be paid more .
about 2,000 west mercia officers are in line for a 1 % rise plus a 1 % bonus as a result .
john campion warned yesterday that unless he gets more funding , this could potentially lead to `` reductions in officer and staff numbers '' .
mr campion said the pay rise was `` deserved '' , but that other forces were getting more money and there needed to be a national debate on the issue .
we have west mids [ police ] right next door , who get significantly more per head in grant than west mercia and pay significantly less per head in council tax than we do .
what i 'm asking for is a fairer discussion at national level as to how we divvy up the police cake . ''

documents.title: dairy industry event opens in telford
text: more than 300 businesses are being represented at the uk dairy day event in telford .
the town 's international centre is hosting the annual event for the fourth year running .
one of the demonstations involves learning about the anatomy of a cow by painting .

documents.title: storm aileen : wind speeds overnight
text: dave throup , from the environment agency in the west midlands , has tweeted this map showing the overnight wind speeds .

documents.title: football : afc telford united up first home win of season
text: afc telford united up their first home win of the season , with a 3-2 victory over stockport county at the bucks head .
the bucks were pegged back twice after taking the lead through goals from john marsden and anthony dwyer , before jordan murphy scored what proved to be the winner on 71 minutes .
the win lifts telford to 12th in the table , just three points off a play-off spot .
every single one of them looks like they 're with me .
and yeah , we 've got some young ones , yeah we 've got some lads who are a little bit inexperienced , but you know what ?
i 'd rather that , because they 're hungry and they want it
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: storm aileen : fallen tree partially blocking road between halfway house and westbury
text: a fallen tree is partially blocking the b4387 between halfway house and westbury , near the railway crossing .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: storm aileen : fallen tree blocking road in albrighton
text: there are reports of a fallen tree blocking half of kingswood road in albrighton , in the east of the county , shropshire council says .
and there are still delays on the railway line between hereford and shrewsbury , because of an earlier fallen tree .

documents.title: shropshire teacher who asked for 'bikini images ' is struck off
text: a teacher who asked children to send him inappropriate photographs of themselves has been given an indefinite teaching ban by a tribunal .
the national college for teaching and leadership found 68-year-old david hugh gideon guilty of unacceptable professional conduct .
mr gideon was a part-time law teacher at the marches school during 2014 before his actions came to light in an investigation by social services in north wales .
the marches school terminated his employment in december 2014 .

documents.title: football : shrewsbury open up gap at the top of league one
text: take another look at the league one table shrewsbury fans - the team remains top after a 1-0 win over southend united last night .
jon nolan scored his first goal for the club on the 23rd minute , to stretch their unbeaten run to seven matches .
and it 's two clean sheets in four days .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: a windy day ahead - watch the latest weather forecast
text: the winds will steadily ease through the day after storm aileen struck overnight , though it will stay quite breezy .
showers will move across the west midlands through the afternoon .
it will feel cooler than yesterday - highs of 16c ( 61f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: storm aileen : rail disruption between hereford and shrewsbury continues
text: the line between hereford and shrewsbury has been cleared of the tree which fell down during last night 's storms , but there are still some delays on the line , with the 07:53 hereford service to shrewsbury cancelled .

documents.title: storm aileen : satellite images of the storm
text: the met office says the storm has brought `` very strong winds '' .
# stormaileen has tracked across the uk overnight bringing very strong winds and heavy rain , with 36.4 mm recorded at bainbridge
there are reports of fallen trees and power outages due to the strong winds from # stormaileen .
here are some of the strongest gusts recorded
when is the next one ?
what name has it got ?
hi craig the next storm will be brian but we 're not currently forecasting one .
learn more about storms here : ^isabel
why are most of the storms in he u.k. named after people in nursing homes ?
hello elliot , all of the names were chosen from popular suggestions made by members of the public : ^isabel
hello damon , all names were chosen from popular suggestions made by members of the public .
^isabel
having just gone thru hurricane irma i wonder why the met office dont call aileen a cat 1 hurricane ?
winds over 74mph ?
hi paul , the reason for this is that hurricanes must form over tro waters .
learn more about this here : ^isabel
thank you-didnt know that !
ok. 14 inches is respectable .
it 's 1.4 inches !
whups .
misread as cm .
really ?
you name storms that drop 1.4 inches overnight , in a non-desert ?
how quaint
there were wind gusts up to 74 mph .
previously storms were only named for rain impacts but now if there is an amber warning for snow/wind
stop naming storms you 're an embarrassment , great for the gutter press of course .
i 'm sure people in the caribbean will be praying for our safety .
congratulations on writing a great uk gov tweet .
( ranked 43rd for sep 13 . )
z # y
issa mess

documents.title: one person in hospital after lorry overturns
text: one person was taken to hospital after a lorry overturned near preston gubbals on the a528 yesterday .
it was in collision with a 4x4 vehicle at 16:36 .

documents.title: weather : how will storm aileen affect this area ?
text: there 's a yellow warning for wind over the course of breakfast time this morning -strong winds are expected with gusts of 50-60mph likely to cause difficult driving conditions .
it 'll be a windy start with blustery conditions steadily easing over the course of the day .
expect a mixture of bright spells and scattered showers .
highs of17c ( 63f ) .
author: Alex Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: storm aileen : winds easing across shropshire
text: the high winds we saw last night from storm aileen are easing , but we could still see gusts of up to 20mph ( 32km/h ) in parts of the county through the morning .
later in the day we are forecast some rain .
we 'll keep you up to date with the effects of the storm this morning .

documents.title: live updates for wednesday
text: welcome to live updates from the bbc on wednesday morning .
we 'll be bringing you the latest news , sport , travel and weather as it happens between now and 18:00 .

documents.title: shrewsbury town 1-0 southend united
text: shrewsbury town 1-0 southend united

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from tomorrow and we will keep you up to date with the impact of storm aileen .

documents.title: weather warning for strong winds
text: be prepared for strong winds and heavy rain overnight - that 's the warning from the met office as storm aileen looks set to visit .
# stormaileen visiting west midlands tonight with rain and strong winds .
potential for tree damage .
drive carefully .
secure garden furniture
hey

documents.title: dawley school told to improve by inspectors
text: dawley 's captain webb school has been told to improve by inspectors .
ofsted says `` staffing challenges '' have affected the school 's ability to provide a good education .
but it praises the school 's interim head , who is said to have a clear vision for the school 's future .
author: Tim Page
News Editor, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: twelve projects get lottery cash
text: a dozen good causes in shropshire are getting money from the national lottery 's awards for all fund .
most of the grants are for between £ 9,000 and £ 10,000 , but there are smaller sums too , with st mary 's youth project in cleobury mortimer getting the smallest amount - £ 1,864 .
money will also be spent on improving the car park at uffington village hall , buying new play equipment for longden and funding a training course for blind piano tuners .

documents.title: weather : rain and high winds forecast overnight
text: we 're expecting high winds and rain overnight and there are warnings to be careful on the roads , with storm aileen on its way through the region .
there could be gusts of up to 65 to 75 miles per hour .
author: Alex Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: jrr tolkien lecture in shrewsbury
text: jrr tolkien 's idealised vision of the home , as seen in the world of bilbo baggins , is going to be explored in a free lecture in shrewsbury next wednesday .
professor chris walsh ( below , right ) from the university of chester is going to give the talk at rowley 's house , to coincide with the 80th anniversary of the hobbit being published .
it 's being arranged by university centre shrewsbury and is part of a series of talks this autumn .

documents.title: watch : experienced cast set to make town 's panto 'best ever '
text: paul hendy , the director of shrewsbury 's pantomime , says the combined experience of this year 's cast make it one of the best ever .
they 'll be performing snow white and the seven dwarves this winter , and two thirds of the tickets have already been sold .

documents.title: police pay rise could lead to loss of officers , warns pcc
text: a pay rise for police could lead to a reduction in officers as forces look to fund the increase , west mercia police and crime commissioner has warned .

john campion welcomed the rise but says a pay increase of 1 % for approximately 2,000 officers employed by west mercia police , plus the cost of bonuses , would cost around £ 1m in the first year - the equivalent of around 25 police officers .
mr campion said the pay award recognises that police officers are `` ordinary people doing extraordinary things '' .
the funding has to come from somewhere and there is a risk that by using it for pay increases , it leaves gaps elsewhere , which could potentially lead to reductions in officer and staff numbers .
we need to ensure we continue to provide our communities with the level of service that they deserve and expect to keep them safe . ''

documents.title: santa 's elves sought to help out at christmas
text: telford 's shopping centre has begun the search for people wanting to play the part of elves in its santa 's grotto this christmas .
it says applicants need to be passionate , outgoing and full of christmas cheer and need to be able to work under pressure alongside father christmas .
the job is open to anyone over the age of 17 and a costume is provided .

documents.title: knife angel to get plinth made of surrendered weapons
text: from next monday , bins will be set up in shrewsbury and telford for people to drop off knives they should n't have .
they 'll remain there for four weeks and all the weapons collected will be given to the british ironworks centre to create a plinth for its knife angel sculpture .
west mercia police says it saw a rise in recorded knife crime across shropshire last year , although a large number of them were domestic incidents and involved kitchen knives .
last month the mayor of london 's office said the knife angel sculpture would n't get a place on trafalgar square 's fourth plinth - which is set aside for works of art .

documents.title: car destroyed in telford arson attack
text: a car was completely destroyed in an arson attack in telford .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: your photos : a sunny afternoon in horsehay and newport
text: it 's been a bright september afternoon around shropshire , as you can see from these photos shared by the bbc weather watchers in horsehay ( top ) and newport ( below ) .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: football : town aiming to stay top of the league
text: shrewsbury town have the ideal chance tonight to consolidate the top spot in league one .
following saturday 's win over wigan that took town into first place , they have another home game tonight - against southend .
team captain abu ogogo is asking his team-mates to give nothing less than a 100 per cent .
we ca n't go into the game thinking that we expect to turn up and win and get the three points .
as soon as you start thinking - this team 's going to be easy - that 's when you slip up . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: health boss defends continuing healthcare funding
text: shropshire has improved the way it allocates funding to people who need continuing healthcare , the head of the shropshire clinical commissioning group has said .

dr julian povey was reacting to figures obtained by the bbc which show three quarters of those who were assessed for the 12 months to july were denied further funding - which is below the national average .
but dr povey said : `` overall , shropshire is running the process in the way that it is supposed to be run . ''
and he also said that in the past , the ccg felt it was paying out more than its fair share in cases where shropshire council was also meant to contribute .
i think that has been a historic issue , where we have n't been as good as we could have been in terms of reviewing packages of care when people 's needs change . ''

documents.title: carpet fitter terrified four women in road rage incident near ellesmere
text: a carpet fitter was armed with a craft knife when he confronted four young women in a late-night road rage attack on a country lane near ellesmere , a court heard .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: football : five home games , five defeats
text: can afc telford united turn around their poor home form tonight ?
they still have n't won at the new bucks head this season , but have been up points on the road .
tonight they take on stockport at home , kick-off is 19:45 .
defender ross white feels the players need to keep it simple - and not let their recent record get to them .
we need to get the home and away form out of our heads and we just need to keep the same mentality , which is brilliant in every game . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: telford mp says hospital 'paralysis ' is putting services at risk
text: the mp for telford has told a debate in parliament it has taken too long to decide the future of shropshire hospitals - and that it has put services at risk .
speaking in westminster hall this morning , lucy allan said delays had resulted in `` dwindling services that do not meet the needs of local people , despite the best efforts of staff '' .
it is now four years since the start of the nhs future fit review of services .
proposals to have just one emergency centre in the county and to move specialist women and children 's services to shrewsbury are expected to go out to public consultation next month .
this paralysis has put at risk our services .
it has led to difficulties in attracting and retaining staff .
so much so that there now is a genuine risk that insufficient staff may lead to closures at night time . ''

documents.title: fire authority urges pcc to 'ditch ' takeover plan
text: the councillors who run shropshire 's fire service are hoping that 'public opinion ' will scrap plans for the region 's police commissioner to take control .
a three-month consultation into the proposals from west mercia pcc john campion has ended .
councillor eric carter , who chairs the shropshire & wrekin fire authority , says the plan ignores people 's wishes and wo n't improve the brigade .
west mercia police and crime commissioner john campion said he was grateful for the fire authority 's comments - which will be considered in due course along with all the other responses received .

documents.title: football : shrewsbury 's ogogo enjoying life at the top
text: being top of the league is an unfamiliar feeling for the shrewsbury town squad , but midfielder abu ogogo is enjoying every minute and wants to stay there .
they face southend united at home later today .
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: weather watchers : bright sunshine for now , but rain is due later
text: it 's looking stunning across the county today , but heavy rain is forecast to hit shropshire this evening with very strong winds overnight .
but for now , take a look at these great shots of ludlow ( top ) and longnor ( bottom ) .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: prisons in the region are full , figures show
text: almost all prisons in the midlands are fuller than they should be - with some having nearly a third more inmates than they were designed for .
ministry of justice figures show many are effectively full .
stoke heath prison , near market drayton is running at 98 per cent capacity .

documents.title: shropshire named among best places to be a woman
text: we always knew it was a great place to live - but if you 're a woman and living in shropshire , new research suggests you 've got it better than most others in the country .
research for bbc radio 4 's woman 's hour factored in issues such as the gender pay gap and education .

the national centre for social research analysis used data from a number of sources , including the office for national statistics ' 2016 annual population survey and the 2011 census covering england , wales and scotland but not northern ireland .
women in the county scored shropshire highly for the environment , culture and safety of the region .
author: BBC Radio 4

documents.title: football standing fundraising extended
text: football standing fundraising extended

documents.title: southend striker to miss shrewsbury game because of curfew
text: nile ranger will miss southend united 's league one game against shrewsbury town later because of a curfew .
the striker , 26 , was released from prison in august having served 10 weeks of an eight-month sentence after admitting online banking fraud .
ranger has featured in southend 's past two games but manager phil brown says his electronic tag will mean he misses the 19:45 bst kick-off in shropshire .
`` unfortunately the tag is causing me a problem , '' said brown .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: health debate : mp says people are being misled
text: wrekin mp mark pritchard says he hopes a westminster debate into the county 's hospital re-organisation will highlight the `` fundamental flaws '' in the process .
health bosses want a state-of-the-art emergency centre at the royal shrewsbury hospital , supported by an urgent care centre both there and at telford 's princess royal hospital .
the public will get to have their say before a final decision is reached .
there 's a lot of mis-infomation out there , but the key thing is this decision needs to be done quickly .

documents.title: warnings of high winds issued
text: storm aileen is expected to bring strong winds tonight and tomorrow morning across the region , the met office is warning .
it is expected to cause disruption from 20:00 this evening , with the chance of power cuts and damage to trees .
a severe weather alert has also been issued by highways england which is advising users of caravans , motorbikes and high-sided vehicles to take extra care when travelling .
for further info regarding the he severe weather warning active later today from 9pm for strong winds pls see link

documents.title: delays for motorists after three-vehicle m54 crash
text: motorists faced rush hour delays this morning following a three-vehicle crash on the m54 in shropshire .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: safe standing campaign to stay open until money raised
text: the deadline to raise the money needed for safe standing at shrewsbury town fc was due to end this evening , but it 's been extended .
supporters had raised £ 47,323 towards the final £ 75,000 total required .

the end date was merely an indicative point to aim for and the real objective is to raise the money we need to introduce the first rail seating section in england & wales , so we will keep the campaign open till we do .
the club is behind this effort 100 % .
i have no doubt the safe standing community will make this happen .

documents.title: your after the rain , here comes the sun
text: it 's a glorious start across the county this morning .
thanks to these early from our weather watchers just over the border in llangollen ( top ) and in myddle ( bottom ) .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: deadline extended for safe standing appeal
text: a crowdfunding appeal to install safe standing at shrewsbury town football club has been extended .
supporters were trying to raise £ 75,000 to pay for more than 500 rail seats at the ground , but with hours to go until today 's 18:00 deadline they were still short by just over £ 27,000 .
the club has now given fundraisers the time they need to get the full amount .

documents.title: debate in parliament on future of hospitals
text: a parliamentary debate on the future of shropshire 's hospitals is going to be held this morning .
it has been arranged by the mps for telford and the wrekin and will be held in westminster hall .
proposals being put forward by the nhs future fit review team involve downgrading telford 's a & e department and moving specialist women and children 's services to shrewsbury .

documents.title: video : your 50-second weather forecast
text: a bright start with sunny spells and the chance of a few isolated showers later on - and highs of 18c ( 64f ) .
a warning for wind has been issued for later this evening and tonight which could cause travel disruption .
author: Alex Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: tuesday : live updates for shropshire
text: welcome to live updates from bbc shropshire on tuesday morning .
we 'll be bringing you the latest news , sport , travel and weather as it happens between now and 18:00 .
if you 'd like to get in touch you can email , tweet us on @ twitterid or message via facebook .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: power station demolition a 'complicated job '
text: there 's a lot of work involved in the first phase of the ironbridge power station demolition , including the removal of asbestos .
demolition engineer anthony hopkinson said the work , which involves knocking down a number of structures on the buildwas site , but not the chimneys , should take six weeks .
mr hopkinson said alternative roosts might also have to be built to house bats which were found living at the site .

documents.title: weather : a cloudy night and more showers tomorrow
text: it 's going to be a cloudy night and we should have a bright start to the day tomorrow , but there could be showers later in the day .
author: Alex Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: hospitals question sepsis figures
text: the bbc 's panorama programme has found nhs figures suggesting only 28 % of patients who need antibiotics for sepsis at shrewbury and telford hospital trust get them within the recommended one-and-a-half hours - that 's below the national average .
the hospitals have responded by saying the figures may contain anomalies and that they have more recent figures suggesting 67 % of patients received antibiotics within an hour of being diagnosed .
the hospitals also say they 've been working to improve sepsis care by working with the virginia mason institute in seattle .

documents.title: your photos : cloud and rain in ludlow and oakengates
text: it 's been another wet and cloudy september day , as you can see from these photos taken by the bbc weather watchers .
these show the scene near ludlow ( top ) and in oakengates ( below ) .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: watch : work to repair much wenlock books complete
text: two historically important books from much wenlock have been restored at a cost of £ 20,000 .
the first , dates back to the 15th century and was made out of paper , which was scarce at the time .
over the centuries , the books - containing the minutes of meetings of the `` burgess of wenlock borough '' - were damaged by damp , but after months of painstaking work they 've been repaired .
author: Kate Tebby
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: couple shocked as car smashes into telford house
text: a retired telford couple were forced to leave their telford home after a car veered off the road in wet conditions and crashed into it .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: football : defender sadler sees a long season ahead
text: shrewsbury town defender matt sadler says it 's far too soon to be touting shrewsbury as promotion contenders
sadler won promotion during his first spell with the club and said : `` it 's all great at the moment , but it 's a long old season '' .
shrewsbury top the league one table after winning five and drawing one of their first six games .
there 's going to be injury , there 's going to be suspension , there 's going to be plenty of things and the challenge will be to rise above whatever is thrown our way . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: new execution date for death row correspondent
text: a shropshire quaker says the man he 's been writing to on death row in the usa for 26 years has been given a new execution date .
jan arriens from bishop 's castle says convicted murderer mike lambrix is due to be killed next month .
lambrix was due to be executed in 2016 before a last-minute stay of execution .
it 's just really sad i think that the authorities ca n't focus on the man he now is and indeed wo n't focus on the actual circumstances at the time of the offence . ''
author: Kate Tebby
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: stabbed police dog back on duty
text: a west mercia police dog which was stabbed on a job last month has returned to light duties .
five-year-old pd canto was seriously injured and had to have surgery following the attack at a property in bridgnorth .
vets say he 's now recovered - and he 'll be eased back into work over the next couple of weeks .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Local Live

documents.title: safe standing appeal still a long way short of target
text: with one day to go , shrewsbury town fans are still £ 27,848 short of the £ 75,000 they wanted to raise to install a safe standing area in their stadium .
they launched a crowdfunding appeal on 1 august with the aim of installing about 500 rail seats .
the £ 47,152 raised so far includes £ 20,000 from the football club itself .
the supporters parliament , which is behind the bid , has said it may look at other sources of funding .

documents.title: american football : brit bowl triumph for revolution
text: shropshire revolution have claimed their first brit bowl trophy , with a 31-7 victory over glasgow tigers in leeds .
it completes a perfect season for the team , who won all 10 games in the nfc 2 south .
the revolution 's wide receiver mark phillips was named the game 's most valuable player .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: fire at biomass plant
text: there 's been a fire at the marches biogas plant at woofferton , in south shropshire .
shropshire firefighters were called there just before 08:30 and are still there , but say they now have it under control .
they say the fire involved a `` large quantity of dry fibre biomass fuel '' .

documents.title: oswestry b & b told to stop running restaurant
text: shropshire council has warned any continued use of a bed and breakfast as a pub or a restaurant is unauthorised .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: cricket : new date for over-60s final after washout
text: shropshire 's over-60s cricket team will try again to play their national final , after the fixture was rained off at the weekend .
the match against essex will now be replayed on sunday .

documents.title: mother threw newborn out of window
text: mother threw newborn out of window

documents.title: holiday couple say hurricane irma 'very scary '
text: a shropshire couple who are on holiday in orlando have said hurricane irma has been `` very scary '' , but `` not as bad as they were forecasting earlier this week '' .
andrew and sandy trickett also said they thought they were lucky compared with people in south west florida , who have been evacuated .

the hurricane has brought winds of up to 75mph ( 120km/h ) and flooding to parts of the state and more than three million homes have been without power , but it is expected to be downgraded to a tro storm today .
mr trickett , who is 56 , said the winds where they were staying had reached 68mph ( 109km/h ) and there had been a 24-hour curfew in place .

documents.title: work to fill underpasses begins today
text: work to fill three underpasses in the brookside area of telford begins today .
they were built in the 1970s and over the next 18 weeks will be filled with foam concrete and replaced with new overground paths .
telford and wrekin council says more than 100 crimes linked to the underpasses were reported in 2016 alone .
author: Ian Perry
BBC Radio Shropshire

documents.title: car crashes into house in dawley
text: a car crashed into a house in telford overnight .
fire crews and the police were called to the incident on holly road in dawley just before midnight .
the people living in the house were advised to leave while a structural engineer looked over the property .
author: Carlie Swain
BBC Local Live

documents.title: football : shrewsbury manager wants players to remember wigan game
text: shrewsbury town have had a dream start to their league one season and sit at the top of the table after their 1-0 win over wigan at the weekend - but manager paul hurst knows there will be tough times ahead .
and he says he wants the players to remember the good performances like the one on saturday , when their backs are up against the wall in the future .
shrewsbury will be at home to southend united tomorrow .

i said to the players , we know full well there will be ups and downs throughout the season , but when we do have a down i think today is a day that we can look at and just remind ourselves that when we 're at it , when we 're all pulling in the same direction , backing our teammates up , have that spirit and some decent play as well , that we 're not a bad side . ''
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: your photos : rainbow in peplow and blue sky in longnor
text: we 've had our first rainbow photo of the week .
this one was taken at peplow in north shropshire , by one of the bbc weather watchers .
and the photo below was taken in longnor
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: shrewsbury mp to attend memorial for war hero great uncle
text: shrewsbury mp daniel kawczynski will be attending a ceremony in poland this month in honour of his great uncle jan kawczynski .
the ceremony will be held in warsaw and will honour three polish families for their work during world war two .
daniel 's great uncle was executed because he hid 12 jewish families from the german army .

documents.title: ice hockey : tigers hold on for cup win over bison
text: telford tigers came back from a goal down against the basingstoke bison last night , to win their autumn cup game 2-1 at the telford ice rink .
and they had to hold on for the last six minutes with a man down , after macauley halford was penalised for high sticks and holding .
the tigers ' goals were scored by jonathan weaver and jason silverthorn .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: warning of 65mph winds for west midlands this week
text: most parts of the west midlands could be hit by gusts of wind of up to 55-65mph later this week .
the met office has issued a yellow weather warning , running from 20:00 tomorrow until 10:00 on wednesday .
it says the winds could get up to 75mph in exposed places and that it 's likely to lead to longer travel times and even power cuts .
author: Allen Cook
BBC Local Live

documents.title: woman jailed for throwing baby out of window
text: a woman who gave birth to a baby girl before putting her into a plastic bag and throwing her out of a window has been jailed .
the girl survived but was left with serious brain injuries .
the woman from oswestry was sentenced to 10 years for attempted murder at stafford crown court .
she 's not been named to protect the baby 's identity .
the baby was found outside a house in the meole brace area of shrewsbury in april last year .
author: Carlie Swain
BBC Local Live

documents.title: three out of four denied continuing healthcare funding
text: about three quarters of the 400 people in shropshire assessed by the nhs for continuing healthcare funding have been turned down , figures show .
the statistics , for the 12 months to july , show that nationally fewer than half of those who had a full assessment for the funding were granted it .

in response , both ccgs said they follow the guidance set out in the national framework for nhs continuing healthcare and that they will work with the relevant national bodies and families to ensure that is the case .

documents.title: changes announced for shropshire bus services
text: changes have been announced for a number of bus services running between telford , wolverhampton and shrewsbury .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: more nurses for hospital trust ordered to improve services
text: more than 40 new nurses have been recruited to work in hospitals in shropshire .
the trust that runs the royal shrewsbury and princess royal hospitals says this will help it reduce its reliance on agency nurses and temporary staff .
it follows a special recruitment event designed to show potential employees what working with the trust would be like .
another one is now planned for next week .
nursing staff vacancies were recently highlighted by inspectors as one area of concern , saying the situation was `` impacting on continuity of care '' .

documents.title: shrewsbury town top after wigan win
text: shrewsbury have moved top of league one in a perfect celebration of the club 's 3,000th game in the football league .
a solitary strike from stefan payne was enough to seal the points against wigan at the new meadow .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: work starts on power station demolition
text: work to demolish some of the buildings at ironbridge power station begins today .
this stage of the work will separate the power station from the national grid substation on site .
it 's expected to take six weeks .

documents.title: appeal after town centre rape
text: police are appealing for witnesses after reports of a rape in shrewsbury in the early hours of saturday .
the victim , in their early 20s was attacked near new street .
officers are keen to hear from anyone who saw anything sus in the welsh bridge and frankwell areas and on the towpath between the boathouse pub and pengwern boat club from about 03:10 yesterday .
more police are on patrol and det insp jason everett said such attacks were `` rare '' .

documents.title: video : your 50-second weather forecast
text: there will be a mixture of sunshine and showers today , with some heavy downpours which could be thundery .
it will also feel windy with top temperatures of 18c ( 64f ) .
author: Alex Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: welcome to our live updates for the day
text: welcome to live updates from bbc shropshire on monday morning .
we 'll be bringing you all the news , sport , travel and weather as it happens .
if you 'd like to get in touch you can email , tweet us on @ twitterid or message via facebook .
